abstract.p: Dr Eric Chivian letter indicting Bush administration position on global warming says Pres Bush is ill-advised not to support Dr Robert T Watson, one of most respected scientists in field, to continue as chairman of UN panel on climate change (S)

block.p: Re ''U.S. to Back Scientist From India to Replace Global Warming Expert'' (news article, April 3):
Re ''U.S. to Back Scientist From India to Replace Global Warming Expert'' (news article, April 3):

First, energy lobbyists essentially wrote the Bush-Cheney energy plan for the country, discouraging Americans from conserving energy. Now, not liking the conclusions reached by the international scientific community and our own National Academy of Sciences about global climate change, they have turned on the messenger, Dr. Robert T. Watson, chairman of the United Nations' Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change and one of the country's most respected climate scientists.

The first President Bush supported the Montreal Protocol, which protected the ozone layer, a treaty that Dr. Watson did much to help draft. President George W. Bush has been ill advised in not supporting Dr. Watson now as he is trying to bring the best science to bear to minimize the potential catastrophic effects of global climate change on the planet and human health.
The writer is director of the Center for Health and the Global Environment, Harvard Medical School.
